Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures the Comment for the Business Process.

Business_AssetObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Business_AssetObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Business_AssetObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Remove_Asset_Data.description: A reference to the asset that should be removed.

validation.validation: The asset specified cannot currently be removed because it has other activity in progress.

An asset can only be removed if its events are limited to issue and transfer, and it was either manually registered or registered from a Receipt or Supplier Invoice that is now canceled. If registered from a lease type Supplier Contract the contract must be canceled. Assets that are Discrete Composite Asset or Components of Non-Discrete Composite Asset cannot be removed.
validation.description: An asset can only be removed if its events are limited to issue and transfer, and it was either manually registered or registered from a Receipt or Supplier Invoice that is now canceled. If registered from a lease type Supplier Contract the contract must be canceled. Assets that are Discrete Composite Asset or Components of Non-Discrete Composite Asset cannot be removed.

validation.validation: There must be a complete supplier contract amendment for the asset before Workday can process this asset transaction.

The supplier invoice line has changed and is no longer valid:
[validations]
validation.description: Asset cannot be removed when referencing invalid supplier invoice lines.

Remove_Asset_Data.description: The transaction effective date for the asset removal.

validation.validation: Asset has an event with transaction date after Remove transaction effective date
The  transaction effective date must be less than or equal to today's date.

The transaction effective date is prior to this asset's conversion into Workday. The portion of accumulated depreciation that represents depreciation taken in a prior system will not be included in the depreciation recalculation in Workday.

Asset_Removal_ReasonObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Asset_Removal_ReasonObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Asset_Removal_ReasonObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Remove_Asset_Data.description: A reference to the removal reason for the asset.
Free-form comments to include with the removal event.

description: Contains data used to process the asset removal.
